notes_admin: Columbus uses receiving-land-use limits (Table I) plus strict, distance-based amplified-sound prohibitions. Measurements may be taken at the receiving property boundary or from within the structure when affected (Section 2329.11(B)).

default_quiet_hours: 22:00-07:00 (general quiet hours for amplified sound audible off property)
seo_text: Indianapolis prohibits unlawful noises and sets specific quiet-hour rules for amplified sound and work activity. Construction or repair of buildings is banned 19:00-07:00, and amplified devices that are audible off premises are restricted during 22:00-07:00. See Chapter 391 (Noise).
construction_hours_weekday: No construction or repair of buildings, and no operation of pile drivers or similar equipment, 19:00-07:00 (permits or variances may apply).
construction_hours_weekend: Same as weekdays (19:00-07:00 prohibition).
lawn_equipment_hours: No fixed citywide hours in the code; falls under the general unlawful noise standard, so avoid operation near residences during 22:00-07:00.
party_music_rules: Operating amplified sound so that it is audible off the property between 22:00-07:00 is prohibited; additional plainly audible rules apply in public spaces under Chapter 391, Article III.
complaint_channel: RequestIndy (Mayor's Action Center) for routine code complaints; IMPD non-emergency for active disturbances.
fine_range: Enforced as an ordinance violation under Chapter 391; penalties are set through city enforcement provisions and the court, with amounts escalating for repeat offenses.
bylaw_title: Indianapolis-Marion County Code Section 391-302 - Unlawful Noises
tips: For construction noise, the bright-line window is 19:00-07:00 - note exact times and the type of work (for example hammering, saws, pile driving).
For music or PA systems, document whether sound is audible off the property during 22:00-07:00.
File via RequestIndy with address, dates, times, and short clips; for ongoing or active disturbances, call IMPD non-emergency.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi there - Indy's noise rules limit amplified sound after 10 p.m., and building construction or repair is not allowed 7 p.m.-7 a.m. The music around {{time}} has been carrying into our home. Could you turn it down during quiet hours? Thanks!
templates.landlord_message: Hello, we are experiencing recurring noise that appears to violate Indianapolis Chapter 391 (amplified sound after 10 p.m. or construction after 7 p.m.). Could you address this with the tenant or contractor? I can share a RequestIndy case number and a brief log.

notes_admin: Indianapolis relies on an unlawful or unreasonable noise standard with enumerated categories (amplified sound, construction windows, and similar) rather than fixed decibel limits; enforcement is via Chapter 391 and the general ordinance violation process.

default_quiet_hours: 22:00-07:00 (nighttime hours under JEPB Rule 4)
seo_text: Jacksonville's noise control is set by Ordinance Code Chapter 368 and detailed limits in JEPB Rule 4. Nighttime is 22:00-07:00. Rule 4 sets source-specific dBA limits, construction restrictions at night, and special rules for leaf blowers, public address systems, HVAC, and parking-lot cleaning.
construction_hours_weekday: Nighttime (22:00-07:00): operation of construction or maintenance equipment is prohibited, except generators, mud hogs, and well-point pumps that stay at or below 60 dBA; daytime equipment limits are 65 dBA at a Class A or B receiver (75 dBA for Class C or D) (Rule 4 Section 4.209).
construction_hours_weekend: Same as weekdays (Rule 4 Section 4.209).
lawn_equipment_hours: Leaf and trash blowers plus lawn maintenance equipment: prohibited 21:00-07:00; between 07:00-21:00 they must stay at or below 80 dBA at the complainant's property line (Rule 4 Section 4.215).
party_music_rules: Public address systems must not exceed 60 dBA at the receiving property day or night. Other amplified sound follows the Rule 4 land-use tables and specific sections for HVAC (60 dBA at Class A or B lines), vehicle work (60 dBA day and 55 dBA night), and parking-lot cleaning (65 dBA day and 55 dBA night) (Rule 4 Sections 4.213-4.217).
complaint_channel: 630-CITY (MyJax) or online; the Environmental Quality Division (Air and Noise) handles enforcement and variances; Police for emergencies.
fine_range: Penalties are set under Ordinance Code Sections 368.301-368.303 (criminal and civil), and Rule 4 references those sections; amounts vary by violation and enforcement track.
bylaw_title: Jacksonville Ordinance Code Chapter 368 - Noise Control (with JEPB Rule 4 - Noise Pollution Control)
tips: If construction occurs at night, note whether it is only generators or well-point pumps; the 60 dBA cap applies to those exceptions.
For leaf blowers, include time ranges - operation is banned 21:00-07:00; attach a short clip and indicate where you measured or heard it.
JEPB issues noise variances; ask the Environmental Quality Division or 630-CITY whether a variance is active for a site before reporting after-hours work.
Provide the land-use context (Class A or B residential, and so on) when possible; Rule 4 limits depend on the receiving land class.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi - Jacksonville treats 10 p.m.-7 a.m. as quiet hours. We have been hearing amplified sound from your place around {{time}}. Could you keep it down at night? Leaf blowers are also off-limits after 9 p.m. Thanks for your help!
templates.landlord_message: Hello, there is recurring noise from {{unit/location}}. Rule 4 treats 10 p.m.-7 a.m. as nighttime and restricts several sources (for example, PA systems 60 dBA; lawn equipment banned 9 p.m.-7 a.m.; construction not allowed at night). Incidents logged on {{dates/times}}. Could you address this and confirm that no after-hours variance is in effect? Thank you.

notes_admin: Jacksonville enforces via Chapter 368 and JEPB Rule 4. Rule 4 provides detailed land-use-based dBA limits, explicit nighttime bans for construction and maintenance, and specific caps for HVAC, vehicle work, PA systems, leaf blowers, and parking-lot cleaning.

default_quiet_hours: No fixed citywide 'quiet hours'. Chapter 34 regulates sound by land-use and time-of-day with community sound-level standards and permits; residential noise permits cannot extend past 07:00-23:00.
weekend_quiet_hours: Same as weekdays (no fixed curfew; level limits and permit windows apply).
holiday_quiet_hours: Same as weekends; exemptions or permits may apply for special events or emergency work.
seo_text: Oklahoma City regulates noise through Chapter 34 - Noise, which sets land-use-based community sound-level standards and prohibits "excessive noise" or "noise disturbances." Residential noise permits are capped at 07:00-23:00. See Section 34-3 (prohibited generally) and Section 34-7 (permit limits).
construction_hours_weekday: No blanket citywide hours; if activity exceeds Section 34-6 standards at the receiver, it is unlawful. After-hours work typically requires a Noise Permit (residential permits limited to 07:00-23:00).
construction_hours_weekend: Same as weekdays; night or early-morning work in residential areas generally requires a Noise Permit (not past 23:00).
lawn_equipment_hours: Not specified as a citywide clock curfew; operation must comply with Chapter 34 standards and avoid a noise disturbance.
party_music_rules: Noise disturbances include plainly audible sound that annoys a reasonable person; excessive noise violations include exceeding Section 34-6 standards or permit limits. Noise plainly audible within another dwelling may be chargeable under disturbing-the-peace provisions when not otherwise compliant.
complaint_channel: OKC Action Center (routing to Code Enforcement) for non-emergencies; Police non-emergency for live disturbances.
fine_range: Varies by section and enforcement path (citations under Chapter 34 or disturbing-the-peace; injunctive relief is also available).
bylaw_title: Oklahoma City Municipal Code - Chapter 34 (Noise)
tips: If work or noise occurs late at night in a residential area, ask for the Noise Permit number; residential permits cannot extend past 23:00.
When reporting, note the exact address, source type, dates, times, and whether the noise was audible inside your home or beyond property lines.
Use the Action Center to establish a case record; for active disturbances, call police non-emergency.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi there - OKC regulates noise citywide under Chapter 34. Late-night sound in residential areas generally needs to stay within limits, and permits do not go past 11 p.m. Could you turn it down this evening? Thanks for understanding.
templates.landlord_message: Hello, we are experiencing recurring noise from {{location/source}}. Under OKC Chapter 34, excessive or noise-disturbance violations apply, and residential noise permits do not extend past 11 p.m. Incidents occurred around {{times}} on {{dates}}. Could you address this with the tenant or contractor? I can share a brief log if helpful.

notes_admin: OKC enforces via land-use-based standards (Table I in Chapter 34) using percentile measures; residential noise permits are limited to 07:00-23:00; 2014 amendments clarify that noise plainly audible within a dwelling may be chargeable when not otherwise compliant.

default_quiet_hours: 21:00-07:00 (night period defined in Chapter 80).
seo_text: Milwaukee regulates noise under Chapter 80 - Subchapter 2 (Noise Control). The code defines day as 07:00-21:00 and night as 21:00-07:00, applies octave-band and Noise Rating criteria, and bans lawn or yard equipment operation 21:00-08:00 (snow removal excepted). See MCO Chapter 80.
construction_hours_weekday: No fixed citywide clock; activities must meet Chapter 80 limits. For residential districts, stationary construction equipment on projects longer than 10 days must be shielded or located to avoid unnecessary noise.
construction_hours_weekend: Same as weekdays (limit-based; variances possible).
lawn_equipment_hours: 21:00-08:00 prohibited (snow removal excepted).
party_music_rules: Noise is excessive if it exceeds Chapter 80 octave-band or NRN limits or constitutes a nuisance. Sound-producing devices may be subject to enforcement and, in some cases, seizure (Chapter 80-75).
complaint_channel: Department of Neighborhood Services (DNS) for building or mechanical issues; Milwaukee Police non-emergency for active disturbances.
fine_range: General penalties by class under Chapter 61; special cruising-area violations carry $250-$1,000. Amounts vary by section and repeat status.
bylaw_title: Milwaukee Code of Ordinances - Chapter 80 (Subchapter 2: Noise Control)
tips: Nighttime is 9 p.m.-7 a.m.; keep logs and short clips. Identify whether the source is steady (measurements) or intermittent (nuisance route).
Lawn or yard equipment cannot run before 8 a.m.; trash compacting or collection is restricted near residences overnight.
For live disturbances, call MPD non-emergency (414-933-4444) while the noise is occurring; for building or mechanical noise, file with DNS.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi neighbor - Milwaukee's rules get stricter after 9 p.m. We have been hearing {{describe noise}} around {{times}}. Could you keep it down during the 9 p.m.-7 a.m. hours? Thanks!
templates.landlord_message: Hello, we are experiencing recurring noise from {{unit/location}}. Under MCO Chapter 80 (Noise Control), night is 9 p.m.-7 a.m., and octave-band limits apply. Incidents: {{dates/times}}. Would you remind tenants or contractors? I can share a brief log.

notes_admin: Definitions in Chapter 80 set day at 07:00-21:00 and night at 21:00-07:00. Sections 80-64 and 80-65 provide criteria; the Section 80-64 exemption sets the lawn or yard equipment curfew at 21:00-08:00; penalties appear in Sections 80-90 and 80-91.

default_quiet_hours: 22:00-07:00 (weekdays) and 22:00-08:00 (weekends) - lower residential limits apply; additional plainly audible curfew for amplified sound.
holiday_quiet_hours: 22:00-08:00 (same as weekends unless a permitted event or variance applies).
seo_text: New Orleans' Chapter 66, Article IV - Noise sets receiving-property limits (Table 1). For residential or public space the typical limits are no more than 60 dBA L10 (07:00-22:00) and 55 dBA L10 (22:00-07:00; weekends start 08:00), with corresponding Lmax caps. There are also plainly audible quiet-hour rules for amplified sound in dwellings. See the Code.
construction_hours_weekday: No single citywide clock; construction must meet Table 1 limits at receivers. Outdoor power equipment is prohibited 22:00-07:00.
construction_hours_weekend: Same approach; outdoor power equipment prohibited 22:00-08:00.
lawn_equipment_hours: Outdoors in residential zones: not between 22:00-07:00 (weekdays) and 22:00-08:00 (weekends); daytime limits are 75 dBA at 50 ft for equipment 5 hp or less (82 dBA if above 5 hp).
party_music_rules: Plainly audible sound in or into neighboring dwellings is unlawful: Sunday through Thursday 21:00-10:00; Friday and Saturday 22:30-10:00 (Section 66-203(3)(d)-(e)). Devices in parks or playgrounds require permits and have separate limits.
complaint_channel: NOLA 311 for non-emergency service (routing to Health and Safety and Permits); NOPD for active disturbances.
fine_range: Varies by section and enforcement agency (NOPD or Health and Safety and Permits); penalties escalate for repeat violations.
bylaw_title: New Orleans Code of Ordinances - Chapter 66, Article IV (Noise)
tips: If construction runs after 6 p.m. near residential zoning (or within 300 ft), note the zoning and include photos of site signage in your report.
For amplified music complaints, cite the plainly audible quiet-hour window that applies to your day of week and record where you measured (inside or at the property line).
Use NOLA 311 to create a case number; for live disturbances, call police while the noise is occurring.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi - New Orleans lowers residential limits after 10 p.m., and amplified music cannot be plainly audible into neighboring homes overnight (Sun-Thu 9 p.m.-10 a.m.; Fri-Sat 10:30 p.m.-10 a.m.). We have been hearing {{describe noise}} around {{times}}. Could you keep it down during those hours? Thanks.
templates.landlord_message: Hello, we are experiencing recurring noise from {{unit/location}}. Under City Code Chapter 66 (Noise), residential limits are 60 dBA (day) and 55 dBA (night) and there are plainly audible quiet-hours for amplified sound. Incidents on {{dates/times}}. Could you assist? I can share a 311 case number and brief log.

notes_admin: Table 1 sets receiving-land-use limits (residential or public space 60 L10 day and 55 L10 night with Lmax caps). Section 66-203 adds specific prohibitions, including plainly audible hours in and around dwellings and the power-equipment curfew (22:00-07:00 weekdays; 22:00-08:00 weekends).

default_quiet_hours: 22:00-07:00 (nighttime period for residential limits in Table I).
seo_text: Kansas City, Missouri regulates noise by receiving property and time of day under Chapter 46 - Noise Control. For residential receivers the limits are no more than 60 dBA (07:00-22:00) and 55 dBA (22:00-07:00), with octave-band limits as well. Violations generally require at least 5 dB over ambient, and certain plainly audible rules apply. See Section 46-4 and Section 46-5.
construction_hours_weekday: No fixed citywide construction clock; sources must meet Table I limits. Specific bans include loading or unloading 22:00-07:00 if it disturbs across a residential boundary and refuse or recycling collection 20:00-07:00 in or near residential areas.
construction_hours_weekend: Same as weekdays (limit-based).
lawn_equipment_hours: Domestic power tools (yard or DIY) prohibited 22:00-07:00 on or near residential property unless within Table I limits.
party_music_rules: Plainly audible sound across a residential property line at 50 ft is prohibited. Vehicular stereos must stay within 50 ft by day (08:00-22:00) and 25 ft at night (22:00-08:00). Portable sound in public space must not be plainly audible beyond 50 ft by day and only to the operator at night.
complaint_channel: KCMO 311 (myKCMO) for routine complaints; Police non-emergency for active disturbances.
fine_range: Set by the municipal court under Chapter 46 and general penalty provisions; amounts vary and may escalate for repeat offenses.
bylaw_title: Kansas City Code of Ordinances - Chapter 46 (Noise Control)
tips: Document whether observations were indoors or at the property line; Table I lists indoor and outdoor limits.
Include whether the sound was at least 5 dB above ambient or plainly audible at the specified distances when reporting.
For loading, unloading, or refuse collection occurring overnight near homes, reference Section 46-5 in your report.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi - KCMO lowers residential limits after 10 p.m. (to 55 dBA) and bans yard or DIY tools 10 p.m.-7 a.m. We have been hearing {{describe noise}} around {{times}}. Could you keep it down during those hours? Thanks!
templates.landlord_message: Hello, we are experiencing recurring noise that appears to exceed KCMO Chapter 46 (for example, over residential limits at night or plainly audible across the property line). Incidents on {{dates/times}}. Could you help resolve this? I can share a 311 case number and log.

notes_admin: Section 46-4 sets Table I (residential outdoors 60 dBA day and 55 dBA night; indoors 45 and 40) and requires the source to exceed ambient by at least 5 dB. Section 46-5 lists specific prohibitions, including domestic power tools 22:00-07:00, loading or unloading 22:00-07:00, refuse vehicles 20:00-07:00, and vehicular or portable amplified sound distance standards.

default_quiet_hours: No fixed citywide quiet hours; disturbance standard applies with category-specific restrictions.
weekend_quiet_hours: Vocal restrictions tighten 01:00-07:00 on Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays.
holiday_quiet_hours: Same as weekends; construction remains limited to 07:00-19:00.
seo_text: Kitchener enforces noise through Chapter 450 (Noise By-law). Construction is limited to 07:00-19:00, and late-night shouting or singing is prohibited after 23:00 Sun-Thu and 01:00 Fri-Sat/holidays. See Chapter 450 and the City's noise guidance.
construction_hours_weekday: Construction, demolition, alteration, or repair allowed 07:00-19:00; prohibited 19:00-07:00 (urgent necessity exception).
construction_hours_weekend: Same as weekdays (07:00-19:00 allowed, 19:00-07:00 prohibited).
lawn_equipment_hours: No dedicated schedule; equipment must avoid causing a disturbance and should follow the 07:00-19:00 daytime expectation.
party_music_rules: Shouting, yelling, whistling, or singing that disturbs is prohibited 23:00-07:00 (Sun-Thu) and 01:00-07:00 (Sat, Sun, holidays); amplified sound follows the general disturbance standard.
complaint_channel: Waterloo Regional Police non-emergency (519-570-9777) for live disturbances; City online portal for guidance and exemptions.
fine_range: Up to $10,000 per offence plus costs under the Provincial Offences Act; administrative penalties may also be issued.
bylaw_title: City of Kitchener - Chapter 450 (Noise By-law)
tips: Keep a simple log with dates, times, source, and how the noise affected you.
Record short clips from your property (indoors or at the lot line) with timestamps when safe to do so.
Ask event organizers for their noise exemption details if activity extends past 19:00.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi neighbor - Kitchener limits construction to 7 a.m.-7 p.m. and restricts loud shouting after 11 p.m. Could we keep things quieter after that window? Thanks for working with me.
templates.landlord_message: Hello, recurring noise from {{unit/location}} appears inconsistent with Kitchener's Noise By-law (construction after 7 p.m. or late-night shouting). I have a short log and would appreciate your help resolving it.

notes_admin: Noise By-law Chapter 450 applies citywide with activity-specific restrictions. Construction is capped at 07:00-19:00, and vocal disturbances face overnight limits (23:00 Sun-Thu; 01:00 Sat/Sun/holidays). Event exemptions are available through the City.

default_quiet_hours: Activity-specific prohibitions per Noise By-law 6716 (Table 3-1).
weekend_quiet_hours: No separate universal weekend hours; follow the table of prohibited activities and times.
holiday_quiet_hours: Same as weekends; refer to Table 3-1 for activity-specific restrictions.
seo_text: Windsor's Noise By-law 6716 lists prohibited activities and time windows by land-use area. Construction equipment is generally limited to 06:00-20:00. See By-law 6716 and contact 311 for guidance.
construction_hours_weekday: Construction equipment permitted 06:00-20:00; prohibited 20:00-06:00.
construction_hours_weekend: Same as weekdays unless a permit or exemption applies.
lawn_equipment_hours: Covered by Table 3-1 activity schedule; follow the applicable category for residential areas.
party_music_rules: Amplified sound or other listed activities are prohibited during the hours identified in Table 3-1 for the relevant land-use area.
complaint_channel: Call Windsor Police non-emergency (519-258-6111) for active disturbances; use 311 for by-law inquiries or follow-up.
fine_range: Provincial Offences Act fines apply; amounts depend on the specific offence and set fine schedule.
bylaw_title: City of Windsor - Noise By-law 6716
tips: Note the exact activity, zone, and time so you can match it to Table 3-1 when reporting.
For construction outside 06:00-20:00, gather the contractor name or site signage if available.
Use 311 for non-urgent follow-up or repeated issues; call police while the noise is occurring for quicker enforcement.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi neighbor - Windsor limits many activities after 8 p.m. (for example, construction equipment). Could we keep the noise down outside the allowed hours? Thanks for the help.
templates.landlord_message: Hello, there has been recurring noise from {{unit/location}} outside the hours listed in Windsor's Noise By-law 6716 (Table 3-1). I have a log and would appreciate your assistance addressing it.

notes_admin: By-law 6716 relies on a schedule of activities and prohibited times by land-use area. Construction equipment is limited to 06:00-20:00; other sources (e.g., amplified sound, loading) have their own time bands. Contact 311 for exemption guidance.

default_quiet_hours: Residential tools and construction restricted 22:00-07:00 (later start 09:00 on Sundays and statutory holidays).
weekend_quiet_hours: Tools and construction in residential districts prohibited 22:00-09:00 on Sundays and statutory holidays.
holiday_quiet_hours: Matches weekend restrictions unless a permit extends the hours.
seo_text: Saskatoon's Noise Bylaw No. 8244 limits residential tools and construction after 22:00, requires Sunday and holiday starts at 09:00, and controls outdoor amplified events (11:00-21:00 Mon-Thu; later on weekends). See Bylaw 8244 and the City overview.
construction_hours_weekday: Construction that is plainly audible across a property line prohibited 22:00-07:00 (emergencies exempt).
construction_hours_weekend: Construction prohibited 22:00-09:00 on Sundays and statutory holidays unless exempted.
lawn_equipment_hours: Residential lawn and garden equipment prohibited 22:00-07:00 (22:00-09:00 on Sundays and statutory holidays).
party_music_rules: Outdoor event amplification limited to 11:00-21:00 Mon-Thu, 11:00-22:00 Fri-Sat, and 13:00-18:00 Sun/stat holidays unless extended via permit.
complaint_channel: Saskatoon Police Service non-emergency (306-975-8300) for in-progress noise; City bylaw concern form for follow-up.
fine_range: Individuals face minimum $100 (first), $200 (second), $400 (third+) up to $10,000; corporations up to $25,000. Notices of violation may be $100 ($250 for engine brakes).
bylaw_title: City of Saskatoon - Noise Bylaw No. 8244
tips: When reporting, note whether the sound was plainly audible beyond the property line and the exact time window.
For vehicle exhaust complaints, record the plate, time, and location; SPS may require a designated-site test.
Ask event organizers whether they have a permit if amplified sound extends beyond the standard hours.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi neighbor - Saskatoon limits lawn tools and construction after 10 p.m. (and before 9 a.m. on Sundays and holidays). Could we adjust the timing so it stays within the allowed hours? Thanks!
templates.landlord_message: Hello, noise from {{unit/location}} seems to fall outside Saskatoon Bylaw 8244 (for example, tools after 10 p.m. or early Sunday work). I have a brief log and would appreciate your help resolving it.

notes_admin: Bylaw 8244 regulates unreasonable noise and sets quiet hours for residential tools, construction, and outdoor events. Light motor vehicle exhaust is capped at 101.3 dBA potential sound. Fines escalate, and notices of violation offer discounted payments.

default_quiet_hours: Plainly audible threshold tightens to 100 ft during 23:00-07:00 Sun-Thu and 00:00-07:00 Fri-Sat.
weekend_quiet_hours: 00:00-07:00 (Fri-Sat nights) at a 100 ft plainly audible threshold.
holiday_quiet_hours: Matches weekend rules unless otherwise noted by the City.
seo_text: Atlanta's Noise Ordinance (Chapter 74, Article IV) uses a plainly audible test: 300 ft by day/evening and 100 ft overnight. Landscape equipment is barred 20:00-08:00, and construction or loading must meet the 100 ft standard outside daytime windows. See Sections 74-131, 74-133, and 74-134.
construction_hours_weekday: Construction unrestricted 07:00-19:00; outside those hours it must not be plainly audible beyond 100 ft in residential areas.
construction_hours_weekend: Construction unrestricted 09:00-19:00; outside those hours it must meet the 100 ft plainly audible standard.
lawn_equipment_hours: Landscape maintenance devices prohibited 20:00-08:00 in residential and mixed-use districts.
party_music_rules: Amplified sound follows the same plainly audible limits (300 ft day/evening; 100 ft overnight).
complaint_channel: Call ATL311 (311 inside city or 404-546-0311) or APD non-emergency (404-658-6666) while noise is occurring.
fine_range: Violations fall under the general penalty (up to $1,000 fine and/or up to six months imprisonment per offence).
bylaw_title: Atlanta Code of Ordinances - Chapter 74, Article IV (Noise Control)
tips: Report while the noise is ongoing so officers can assess the 100 ft or 300 ft plainly audible thresholds.
Record a short clip indoors and note your distance from the property line when safe.
For construction complaints, log whether the activity occurred outside 07:00-19:00 (weekdays) or 09:00-19:00 (weekends).

templates.neighbor_message: Hi neighbor - Atlanta treats noise plainly audible beyond 100 feet as a violation after 11 p.m. (midnight on weekends). Could we turn it down during those quiet hours? Thanks!
templates.landlord_message: Hello, noise from {{unit/location}} appears to exceed Atlanta's overnight 100-foot standard or the 8 p.m.-8 a.m. landscape rule. I have an ATL311 log and would appreciate your help addressing it.

notes_admin: Atlanta enforces plain audibility distances instead of fixed decibel limits. Landscape devices are prohibited 20:00-08:00; construction and loading must stay within 100 ft audibility at night. General penalty allows fines up to $1,000 or six months jail.

default_quiet_hours: Varies by activity per By-law N-200; many residential disturbances prohibited 23:00-07:00.
weekend_quiet_hours: Schedule A sets additional limits, including prohibited periods on Sundays and holidays for several activities.
holiday_quiet_hours: Statutory, civic, and Remembrance Day carry stricter bans (see Schedule A).
seo_text: Halifax's By-law N-200 regulates noise by activity and time bands (Schedule A). Construction is limited to 07:00-20:00 weekdays, 08:00-19:00 Saturdays, and 09:00-19:00 Sundays/holidays; rock breaking and concrete finishing have tighter windows. See By-law N-200 and the City's noise complaint guide.
construction_hours_weekday: General construction allowed 07:00-20:00; rock breaking 08:00-18:00; concrete finishing allowed until 21:30 with notice.
construction_hours_weekend: Saturdays: construction 08:00-19:00 (rock breaking prohibited); Sundays/holidays: construction 09:00-19:00 unless exempted.
lawn_equipment_hours: Domestic power tools prohibited outside Schedule A letter A hours (before 07:00 and after 21:30 weekdays; before 08:00/after 19:00 Saturdays; before 09:00/after 19:00 Sundays and holidays).
party_music_rules: Amplified sound, PA systems, and other Schedule A activities must comply with their assigned time bands (letters A-D).
complaint_channel: Contact 311 during service hours or Halifax Regional Police non-emergency (902-490-5020) when noise is active.
fine_range: Minimum fines: $300 (first), $700 (second), $1,000 (third+); maximum up to $10,000 and/or one year imprisonment.
bylaw_title: Halifax Regional Municipality - By-law N-200 (Respecting Noise)
tips: Identify the Schedule A letter that applies (e.g., domestic tools, construction, rock breaking) and note the prohibited time band.
Report during the restricted period so officers can assess audibility at your location (point of reception).
Check nearby construction sites for posted exemption notices and note approval numbers if present.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi there - Halifax By-law N-200 limits this type of noise after the posted hours (for example, most tools after 9:30 p.m. weekdays). Could we keep it within the permitted times? Thanks for understanding.
templates.landlord_message: Hello, noise from {{unit/location}} appears to fall outside Halifax By-law N-200 Schedule A (for example, construction after 8 p.m. or Sunday work without approval). I have a brief log and would appreciate your help confirming compliance.

notes_admin: By-law N-200 relies on Schedule A time bands (letters A-G) enforced via audibility at a point of reception. Construction hours were tightened in 2022; exemptions may be granted for specific work (e.g., concrete finishing).

default_quiet_hours: Night noise offence under the Noise Act 1996 applies 23:00-07:00 with indoor permitted levels.
weekend_quiet_hours: Same night noise offence hours; construction hours vary by borough (typically no noisy works Sundays/Bank Holidays).
holiday_quiet_hours: Night noise offence still applies; most boroughs prohibit noisy construction on Bank Holidays unless specially authorised.
seo_text: London councils enforce the Noise Act 1996 (night noise 23:00-07:00 with indoor permitted levels) and local construction hours, often 08:00-18:00 Mon-Fri and 08:00-13:00 Sat with no noisy works on Sundays/Bank Holidays. Check your borough's rules via GOV.UK.
residential_decibel_limit_day: Night noise permitted level: 34 dBA if background is 24 dBA or lower, otherwise 10 dBA above background (measured indoors).
residential_decibel_limit_night: Night noise permitted level: 34 dBA if background is 24 dBA or lower, otherwise 10 dBA above background (measured indoors).
construction_hours_weekday: Typical borough guidance: noisy works 08:00-18:00 (check local authority for exact rules).
construction_hours_weekend: Common pattern: 08:00-13:00 Saturday; no noisy works Sunday/Bank Holiday without permission (varies by borough).
lawn_equipment_hours: Falls under statutory nuisance and borough rules; keep to daytime hours to avoid enforcement.
party_music_rules: Night noise warnings can lead to Fixed Penalty Notices if indoor permitted levels are exceeded after a warning notice.
complaint_channel: Report to your borough council's environmental health/noise team; use GOV.UK to find the correct council.
fine_range: Fixed Penalty Notice up to Â£110 for dwellings (Â£500 for licensed premises); prosecution can reach Â£1,000 for dwellings, plus potential equipment seizure.
first_offense_fine: Fixed Penalty up to Â£110 (dwellings) once a warning notice has been issued.
bylaw_title: Noise Act 1996 and borough construction codes
tips: Keep a noise diary and invite council officers to witness the noise inside your dwelling if safe.
Check your borough's construction hours and out-of-hours approval process before reporting building work.
Ask about equipment seizure powers if repeated offences continue after warnings or Fixed Penalty Notices.

templates.neighbor_message: Hello - councils enforce night noise rules between 11 p.m. and 7 a.m. Could you please keep the noise down during those hours? Thank you.
templates.landlord_message: Hello, there has been recurring noise or out-of-hours work at {{address}} that appears to breach the 11 p.m.-7 a.m. night noise rules or local construction hours. I have a log and will contact the council if it continues. Could you help address it?

notes_admin: The Noise Act 1996 sets nationwide night noise standards; councils also use Environmental Protection Act powers and local construction codes (e.g., Westminster, Camden, City of London). Residents report via their borough; construction exemptions are handled locally.

default_quiet_hours: 22:00-07:00 (night period; domestic power tools and most construction prohibited without permission).
seo_text: Regina regulates community noise through Noise Abatement Bylaw No. 6980, which sets residential receiving-property limits of no more than 60 dBA (07:00-22:00) and no more than 55 dBA (22:00-07:00) and bans domestic power tools and most construction during 22:00-07:00. See the City's noise bylaw page and the consolidated bylaw PDF.
construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-22:00 (Sections 7 and 7.1; work outside these hours requires permission and must not be audible in a residential building).
construction_hours_weekend: 07:00-22:00 (same as weekdays; City or emergency works may be exempt).
lawn_equipment_hours: Domestic power tools (mowers, trimmers, and similar) prohibited 22:00-07:00 in residential zones.
party_music_rules: General prohibition on unreasonable or excessive noise; amplification audible to the street or public requires a permit. The night period (22:00-07:00) is strictly enforced.
complaint_channel: Service Regina (Bylaw Enforcement) for daytime; Regina Police Service for after-hours disturbances.
fine_range: Up to $2,000 for an individual or $5,000 for a corporation, plus up to 30 days imprisonment.
bylaw_title: City of Regina - Noise Abatement Bylaw No. 6980
tips: When reporting, note the receiving location (inside or at your lot line) and whether it was during the day or night period.
For construction after 22:00 or before 07:00, cite Section 7 and ask if City permission was granted.
Include short clips and a dated log; submit via Service Regina and keep the request number. Call Regina Police Service after hours.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi - Regina's noise bylaw limits residential sound after 10 p.m., and tools or construction are not allowed 10 p.m.-7 a.m. We have been hearing {{describe noise}} around {{times}}. Could we keep it down during those hours? Thanks very much.
templates.landlord_message: Hello, we are experiencing recurring noise that appears to exceed Regina's Noise Abatement Bylaw No. 6980 (60 dBA by day, 55 dBA at night; tools and construction restricted 10 p.m.-7 a.m.). Could you address this with the tenant or contractor? We have logged dates and times and can share our Service Regina case number.

notes_admin: Sections 7 and 7.1 set land-use limits (Residential 60/55 dBA; Mixed Use 70/60; within 30 m of Residential 70/65; others 85/75). Construction and domestic power tools are prohibited 22:00-07:00 unless authorised. Sources: City noise bylaw page and Bylaw 6980 PDF.

default_quiet_hours: 21:00-07:00 (night period with lower permitted levels).
seo_text: Laval's Reglement L-12423 (bruit communautaire) sets residential maxima of no more than 55 dBA (07:00-21:00) and no more than 50 dBA (21:00-07:00) outdoors, and no more than 45 dBA by day / 40 dBA at night indoors. Construction is allowed Monday-Friday 07:00-19:00 and Saturday 09:00-17:00 (not on Sundays or holidays). See the City's noise page and the codified bylaw PDF.
construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-19:00 (Monday-Friday).
construction_hours_weekend: Saturday 09:00-17:00; Sundays and statutory holidays not permitted.
lawn_equipment_hours: Monday-Friday 07:00-20:00; Saturday, Sunday, and holidays 09:00-17:00.
party_music_rules: Sound generated by persons or musical devices is regulated; disturbances are handled by police and must remain within the bylaw dBA maxima at the point of reception.
complaint_channel: 311 Laval (or 450-978-8000) for service requests; police for urgent disturbances.
fine_range: Individuals: $200-$1,000 CAD first offence, $400-$2,000 CAD repeat. Corporations: $400-$2,000 CAD first offence, $800-$4,000 CAD repeat.
bylaw_title: Ville de Laval - Reglement L-12423 (bruit communautaire)
tips: Specify whether the sound was measured or heard outdoors or indoors, as limits differ.
For weekend work, note that construction is not permitted on Sundays or statutory holidays without authorisation.
Include short clips and a log; file via 311 and keep the request number for follow-up.

templates.neighbor_message: Bonjour - Le reglement sur le bruit de Laval abaisse les seuils la nuit (21 h-7 h) et fixe des limites de 55 dBA le jour et 50 dBA la nuit a l'exterieur. On entend {{decrire le bruit}} vers {{heures}}. Pourriez-vous reduire le volume en soiree et la nuit? Merci!
templates.landlord_message: Bonjour, nous subissons du bruit recurrent qui semble exceder le Reglement L-12423 (55 dBA jour / 50 dBA nuit dehors; 45/40 dBA dedans) et/ou les heures de travaux (lun-ven 7 h-19 h; sam 9 h-17 h; pas de travaux le dimanche). Pourriez-vous intervenir? Nous avons un journal des incidents et un numero de requete 311.

notes_admin: The City noise page summarises outdoor 55/50 dBA and indoor 45/40 dBA limits, construction and landscaping windows, and fine ranges. Reglement L-12423 codifies the details.

default_quiet_hours: 23:00-07:00 (night period defined in Reglement 44-2003).
seo_text: Gatineau's Reglement no 44-2003 - Bruit defines jour as 07:00-23:00 and nuit as 23:00-07:00, restricts construction within 150 m of dwellings to Monday-Saturday 07:00-21:00, and caps certain mechanical equipment at no more than 55 dBA at an occupant's location. See the City's noise page and the regulation text PDF.
construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-21:00 (Monday-Saturday) for construction, renovation, or demolition within 150 m of an accommodation building.
construction_hours_weekend: Sunday: not permitted within 150 m of an accommodation building unless emergency or authorised.
lawn_equipment_hours: Generally allowed 07:00-23:00; prohibited at night (23:00-07:00) if of a nature to disturb (saws, mowers, blowers, and similar).
party_music_rules: Use of a sound device perceptible outside and of a nature to disturb is prohibited; vehicle-mounted amplification perceptible outside is likewise prohibited.
complaint_channel: 311 (Centre d'appels non urgents) via phone or online; police for emergencies.
fine_range: Minimum $200 (personne physique) or $500 (personne morale) for a first offence, with higher minimums for repeats; each day is a separate offence.
bylaw_title: Ville de Gatineau - Reglement no 44-2003 (bruit)
tips: If work occurs on Sunday or outside 07:00-21:00 near homes, cite Article 7 (within 150 m, Monday-Saturday only, 07:00-21:00).
For mechanical equipment such as heat pumps, note if levels appear above 55 dBA at an occupant's location (Article 11).
File via 311 and retain the case number; ombudsman processes are available if City handling is unsatisfactory.

templates.neighbor_message: Bonjour - A Gatineau, la nuit est definie 23 h-7 h. Les travaux pres des habitations sont limites au lun-sam 7 h-21 h, et l'usage d'appareils sonores perceptibles dehors et derangeants est interdit. On entend {{decrire le bruit}} vers {{heures}}. Pourriez-vous reduire le bruit la nuit? Merci!
templates.landlord_message: Bonjour, nous subissons du bruit recurrent a {{adresse/unite}}. Le Reglement 44-2003 limite les travaux (lun-sam 7 h-21 h pres des habitations) et encadre les appareils sonores; certaines machines ne doivent pas depasser 55 dBA. Incidents aux dates et heures suivantes. Merci d'intervenir; nous avons un numero de requete 311.

notes_admin: Article 5 bans loading or unloading 22:00-07:00 if disturbing. Article 7 limits construction within 150 m of accommodation buildings to Monday-Saturday 07:00-21:00. Articles 9-11 set night restrictions for mechanical devices and a 55 dBA cap at an occupant's location.

default_quiet_hours: No fixed citywide quiet hours; nuisance standard applies at all hours (By-law 7044 Section B).
weekend_quiet_hours: No fixed curfew; nuisance standard applies (construction rules differ).
holiday_quiet_hours: No fixed curfew; nuisance standard applies (construction rules differ).
seo_text: Surrey controls noise through Noise Control By-law, 1982, No. 7044, which prohibits noise that disturbs the peace at any time and sets specific construction hours 07:00-22:00 daily (with no for-profit construction on Sundays unless an exception is granted). See the by-law PDF and the City's construction hours and exception guidance handout and Noise Extension Bylaw Permit.
construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-22:00 (exceptions require written approval).
construction_hours_weekend: Saturday 07:00-22:00; Sunday: no for-profit construction (homeowners may work on their own property); exceptions by written approval.
lawn_equipment_hours: No specific clock curfew; equipment must not disturb neighbours under Section B.
party_music_rules: Amplified sound such as radios or stereos may not be played so as to disturb the neighbourhood (Section B.3).
complaint_channel: City of Surrey Bylaw Enforcement (Report a Problem) for non-emergencies; Surrey Police Service non-emergency for active disturbances.
fine_range: $100-$2,000 per offence; each day is a separate offence (Section E).
bylaw_title: City of Surrey - Noise Control By-law, 1982, No. 7044
tips: For construction outside 07:00-22:00, ask for the written approval or exception and cite Section C of the by-law.
Include exact times, address or source, and short clips recorded from your property when you report.
Use the City's Report a Problem tool for a case number; call police non-emergency for active late-night disturbances.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi - Surrey's noise by-law prohibits noise that disturbs at any time, and construction is limited to 7 a.m.-10 p.m. (no for-profit work on Sundays). We have been hearing {{describe noise}} around {{times}}. Could you keep it down, especially at night? Thanks!
templates.landlord_message: Hello, we are experiencing recurring noise from {{unit/location}} that appears to contravene Surrey's Noise Control By-law 7044 (nuisance noise at any time; construction hours 7 a.m.-10 p.m., no for-profit work Sundays). Incidents on {{dates/times}}. Could you help address this? I can share our case number and a brief log.

notes_admin: By-law 7044 sets general nuisance prohibitions (no fixed dB) and specific construction hours; the Sunday rule bars for-profit construction. Agricultural noise scare devices have limited time windows (Section B.6).

default_quiet_hours: Many residential restrictions begin 21:00-07:00 (earlier weekend morning starts for some activities).
weekend_quiet_hours: 21:00-09:00 for many residential activities; nuisance standard applies at all times.
holiday_quiet_hours: 21:00-09:00 for many residential activities; nuisance standard applies at all times.
seo_text: Brampton's Noise By-law 93-84 prohibits unreasonable noise and sets specific time windows. The City advises that operating heavy construction equipment is not permitted 21:00-07:00 (until 09:00 on Saturdays, Sundays, and statutory holidays), and residential power devices (for example, lawnmowers or trimmers) follow the same 21:00-07:00/09:00 restriction. See the City's 311 knowledge base on construction noise and the 311 portal for continuous noise complaints.
construction_hours_weekday: Heavy equipment or machinery not permitted 21:00-07:00.
construction_hours_weekend: Not permitted 21:00-09:00 on Saturdays, Sundays, and statutory holidays.
lawn_equipment_hours: Residential power devices outdoors not permitted 21:00-07:00 (to 09:00 on Saturdays, Sundays, and statutory holidays).
party_music_rules: Unreasonable or persistent noise such as loud music, shouting, or singing is prohibited; recurring disturbances may be treated as continuous noise.
complaint_channel: Brampton 311 (online or phone) for by-law enforcement; Police non-emergency for active disturbances.
fine_range: Up to $5,000 under the City's by-law enforcement regime.
bylaw_title: City of Brampton - Noise By-law 93-84 (overview via 311 Knowledge Base)
tips: When reporting, note whether equipment was used after 21:00 or before 07:00 (09:00 on weekends or holidays).
For recurring issues, create a 311 case each time; the history supports escalation for continuous noise.
Attach short clips and include the exact address and source type (construction, party, power tools).

templates.neighbor_message: Hi - Brampton's rules restrict construction equipment and outdoor power devices after 9 p.m. (until 7 a.m., or 9 a.m. on weekends and holidays). We have been hearing {{describe noise}} around {{times}}. Could you keep it down during those hours? Thanks!
templates.landlord_message: Hello, we are experiencing recurring noise that appears to contravene Brampton's Noise By-law (for example, equipment after 9 p.m. or before permitted hours). Incidents on {{dates/times}}. Could you assist? I can share our 311 case number and a brief log.

notes_admin: By-law 93-84 governs noise. City 311 guidance clarifies typical time windows for construction and power devices; some public works or regional projects may be exempt.

default_quiet_hours: Outdoor amplified sound at residences: 19:00-07:00 (Friday and Saturday permitted until 23:00).
weekend_quiet_hours: Saturday outdoor amplified sound quiet hours 23:00-07:00; Sunday quiet hours 19:00-09:00.
holiday_quiet_hours: Outdoor amplified sound quiet hours 19:00-09:00 unless an exemption is granted.
seo_text: Markham regulates noise under Noise By-law 2017-74. The City summary notes that outdoor amplified music is not allowed 19:00-07:00 (to 09:00 on Sundays), with permitted hours extended to 23:00 on Fridays and Saturdays. Construction using equipment is allowed Monday-Friday 07:00-19:00, Saturday 09:00-17:00, and is prohibited on Sundays and statutory holidays unless exempted. See the City's noise page for details and exemptions: Noise - City of Markham.
construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-19:00 (Monday-Friday).
construction_hours_weekend: Saturday 09:00-17:00; Sundays and statutory holidays not permitted without an exemption.
lawn_equipment_hours: Generally restricted after 19:00; avoid Sundays and statutory holidays unless exempted.
party_music_rules: Outdoor amplified sound at residences is not allowed 19:00-07:00 (to 09:00 on Sundays); Friday and Saturday allow amplification until 23:00 without an exemption.
complaint_channel: City of Markham By-law Enforcement and Licensing (phone or email) or the exemption program; police for urgent disturbances.
fine_range: Administrative Monetary Penalties apply to listed Noise By-law contraventions; amounts vary by offence tier.
bylaw_title: City of Markham - Noise By-law 2017-74 (summary and exemptions)
tips: If you hear outdoor amplified sound after 19:00 (or after 23:00 on Friday or Saturday), note the source and duration and attach a short clip to your report.
For construction on Sundays, statutory holidays, or outside the weekday or Saturday windows, ask whether an exemption was issued.
Administrative Monetary Penalties may apply; include dates, times, and whether the sound was outdoors or indoors.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi - Markham's by-law limits outdoor amplified sound after 7 p.m. (to 9 a.m. on Sundays), with Friday and Saturday permitted until 11 p.m. We have been hearing {{describe noise}} around {{times}}. Could you turn it down during those hours? Thanks very much.
templates.landlord_message: Hello, we are experiencing recurring noise from {{unit/location}} that appears to fall outside Markham's Noise By-law 2017-74 (amplified sound hours or construction windows). Incidents on {{dates/times}}. Could you assist? I can share a short log and links to the City guidance.

notes_admin: The City noise page documents the Friday and Saturday extension to 23:00 for amplified music and limits Saturday construction to 09:00-17:00. Sundays and statutory holidays require an exemption. Quantitative sound limits exist in the by-law schedules but are not listed in the public summary.
